Main Content Region



College of Arts and Letters









Welcome
Welcome to the College of Arts and Letters at California State University, San Bernardino!
We are a dynamic and caring community of students, faculty, and staff members united by a passion for the arts and humanities. Our College inspires students and prepares them for the rapidly changing cultural and employment environment of the 21st century. Our classes are taught by faculty who are experts in their fields, providing students with tools for success in a world that values written and oral communication skills, analysis, critical thinking, and creativity.








 
 







CAL Professor Receives Mentor Award
Dr. Mariam Betlemidze, Communication Studies, is helping students define their future with her exemplary mentorship. 
She's one of four CSUSB professors to be recognized for their outstanding mentorship to students in research and creative activities. 
Read More
Communication Studies







 







Philosophy Welcomes New Chair
Meet the new Chair of Philosophy -- Dr. Matt Davidson!
Despite being the new Chair, Dr. Davidson is not new to the department, nor to this position. He previously served as Chair from 2013-2016. So maybe instead we should say, "Welcome back, Dr. Davidson!"
Learn More
Department of Philosophy







 







Music Welcomes New Chair
Dr. Lesley Leighton is a noted conductor, singer and music educator. At CSUSB, she has taught classes as an assistant professor of music and director of choral activities. Earlier this year, she was named principal guest conductor of the San Bernardino Symphony Orchestra. 
Fun fact: Her voice can be heard on more than 100 film soundtracks, including most recently, "Captain Marvel," the live action film "Mulan," "Frozen II," and the latest version of "The Lion King."
Music Department







 







CAL Professors Win Mini-Grants 
Congratulations to four of our professors who won grants for their research from the Office of Academic Research!
Kaitlyn Creasy, Philosophy, will use her grant to write about Friedrich Nietzsche's account of the social shaping of emotional experience.  
Shafiq Rahman, Communication Studies, will use his grant to explore desi-American identity in the popular Netflix show, "Never Have I Ever."
Rob Ray, Art & Design, will use his grant to prepare for his upcoming exhibition at RAFFMA, "The Long Trip."
Taylor Moon, Art & Design, will use her grant to prepare for her upcoming exhibition at RAFFMA, "Drive-Thru Nation."
 







 







Spring 2022 Student Commencement Speakers
Our Student Commencement Speaker Video is a College of Arts & Letters tradition. It showcases students from each of our departments and allows them to share their inspiring stories and messages during our commencement ceremony. 
Watch on YouTube
This video features: Jaque Holland-Jefferson, Art & Design; Stephanie Alfonso, Communication Studies; Veronica Morales, English; Kaymon Hunter, Liberal Studies; Susan Felix, Music; Jennifer Cisneros, Philosophy; Cassidy Jessup, Theatre Arts; and Kiara Oregon, World Languages & Literatures.







 







CAL Outstanding Students 2021-22
Congratulations to our Outstanding Students for the 2021-22 academic year!
Naim Aburaddi, M.A. Communication Studies, is our Outstanding Graduate Student
Ferris Strachan, B.A. Liberal Studies, is our Outstanding Undergraduate Student
You can learn more about them and read their inspiring stories on Inside CSUSB. 
Inside CSUSB







 







CAL Outstanding Faculty 2021-22
Congratulations to our Outstanding Faculty for the 2021-22 academic year!
Dr. Jessica Luck, English, is our Outstanding Professor in Teaching and Instructional Related Activities
Learn more about Dr. Luck and the classes she teaches
Department of English
M.A. English & Writing Studies







 







CAL Outstanding Faculty 2021-22
Congratulations to our Outstanding Faculty for the 2021-22 academic year!
Dr. Liliana Conlisk-Gallegos, Communication Studies, is our Outstanding Professor in Scholarly, Research, and Creative Activities. 
Learn more about Dr. Conlisk-Gallegos and the classes she teaches
Department of Communication Studies
M.A. Communication Studies







 







CAL Outstanding Faculty 2021-22
Congratulations to our Outstanding Faculty for the 2021-22 academic year!
Dr. Mihaela Popescu, Communication Studies, is our Outstanding Professor in Service
Learn more about Dr. Popescu and her role as Faculty Director of the xREAL Lab on campus
xREAL Lab







 







CAL Outstanding Faculty 2021-22
Congratulations to our Outstanding Faculty for the 2021-22 academic year!
Dr. Jess Nerren, Communication Studies, is our Outstanding Lecturer 
Learn more about Dr. Nerren and the classes she teaches
Department of Communication Studies
M.A. Communication Studies







 







CAL STAR Award Staff Recognition
Andrew Thompson, Art & Design, is our 2021-22 CAL STAR!
“Andrew is indeed a model citizen, creating a safe space in the photography lab, studio, and classroom where all points of view, identities and styles are respected. Many students gravitate towards photography to create images of their constructed identities, and Andrew has helped foster an environment of inclusivity where everyone is welcomed and creatively encouraged.”
– Tom McGovern, Professor Emeritus, Art & Design
Department of Art & Design

Catch up on all our exciting news and events from the Spring '22 semester by scanning the QR code.
